head.title: August 6-12; Despite Protests, Another Texas Execution

hedline.hl1: August 6-12; Despite Protests, Another Texas Execution

block.p: Oliver Cruz, a mentally retarded 33- year-old with an I.Q. of 64, was one of two men executed on Wednesday in Huntsville, Tex. ''The execution of persons who are mentally retarded serves no principled purpose and demeans our system of justice,'' Martha W. Barrett, the president of the American Bar Association, wrote to Gov. George W. Bush. The European Union also had called on Mr. Bush to spare Mr. Cruz, saying the execution of the mentally retarded violated international human rights norms.

George W. Bush. The European Union also had called on Mr. Bush to spare Mr. Cruz, saying the execution of the mentally retarded violated international human rights norms.
Mr. Cruz was condemned to death for the 1988 rape and murder of a 24-year-old woman. His last-minute appeal to the Supreme Court was denied by a 7-to-2 vote.
